item.title: Standalone Python project/installation
item.description: Let’s take an example of installing Django without using Debian apt command. We will use virtualenv to make a self-contained python directory. First create your installation directory: $ mkdir -p project/django $ cd project/django Get the virtualenv tool: $ wget --no-check-certificate 'https://raw.github.com/pypa/virtualenv/develop/virtualenv.py' Create the virtual environment: $ python virtualenv.py --no-site-packages --distribute python_django_env Note interesting parameters:: --no-site-packages Don't give access to the global site-packages dir to the virtual environment --distribute Use Distribute instead of Setuptools.
